instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_SUS: What is PP1V8_SUS? PP1V8_SUS is a 1.8v power rail active in a suspend state..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Good morning, this mac has no sign of oxidation. It does not energize through the USB-c, I tried to connect through the source, the signal "connect the charger" appears, but when connecting it does not turn on.
CPU does not heat up. I imagine that <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> is defective.

L6995 OK;
F7040 OK;
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 80mV;

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP> diode mode
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0.420 
<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL> - 0.190
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SUS</SIGNAL> - 0.430 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_VIN</SIGNAL> - 0.586 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 0.360 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 0.471 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> - 0.512 
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0.565 
<SIGNAL>P1V2S5SW_HSMUX_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.812 
<SIGNAL>PP1V8D_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> - 0.489

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"I tried to connect through the source, the signal "connect the charger" appears, but when connecting it does not turn on"
I'm sure many other people on the forum can NOT really understand what you've wanted to say!!!

Do you get any voltage at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
Check voltage and diode mode at [B][U]ALL[/U][/B] LDO rails of <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:

35 <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>     0.15V / 0.521
53 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL>               0V / 0.509
75 <SIGNAL>PP1V8A_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL>             0V / 0.527

<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> 0V on ALL pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
You must check continuity from USB-C port to the board.
Diode mode to ground at F3050?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: If the fuse is good, then check continuity, as above mentioned.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Have you tried a new USB-C port assembly?...Common for those to fail on this model, and will typically present in the way you're describing. Also make sure your trackpad/cable and battery are both good.
